item.title: Rust vs. Python: Finding the right balance between speed and simplicity
item.description: This blog post was brought to you by Damaso Sanoja, draft.dev. Deciding whether to use Python or Rust isn‚Äôt just a syntax choice; it‚Äôs a career bet. Python usage skyrocketed from 32% [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/rust/2025/11/10/rust-vs-python-finding-the-right-balance-between-speed-and-simplicity/

item.title: The Go Ecosystem in 2025: Key Trends in Frameworks, Tools, and Developer Practices
item.description: Go turns 16 this year. To celebrate this milestone, we have taken a closer look at the latest Developer Ecosystem Survey results and examined the evolution of the Go ecosystem over the past five years. According to JetBrains Data Playground, 2.2 million professional developers use Go as their primary programming language ‚Äì twice as many [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/go/2025/11/10/go-language-trends-ecosystem-2025/

item.title: PhpStorm Plugins You Might Not Know
item.description: PhpStorm comes with a ton of built-in features, and you can add even more with plugins. They bring new languages, tools, and small improvements that make everyday coding smoother. Many of the best ones come from independent developers. One of them is Dmitrii Derepko, who built several handy tools for working with web projects and [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/2025/11/phpstorm-plugins-you-might-not-know/

item.title: Universal Entry Point: A Single Entry Point for Context-Aware Coding Assistance
item.description: Modern IDEs are powerful tools with many useful features. When we talk about developer productivity, one thing that comes to mind is mastering the IDE ‚Äì learning its features, like refactorings, navigation, or code generation, and remembering how to invoke them. item.title: Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) Is Coming Soon to JetBrains AI
item.description: At JetBrains, we‚Äôve always believed in giving developers the best possible tools to enhance productivity and creativity. Recently, you‚Äôve shared important feedback about AI usage limits, transparency, and the freedom to choose which AI providers you use. We heard you loud and clear. That‚Äôs why we are working to introduce bring-your-own-key (BYOK) support for JetBrains [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/bring-your-own-key-byok-is-coming-soon-to-jetbrains-ai/

item.title: IntelliJ Platform 2025.3: What Plugin Developers Should Know
item.description: As we approach the release of IntelliJ IDEA 2025.3, we would like to share key information about changes that may impact your plugin development process. No Immediate Upgrade Required If you built your plugin [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2025/11/intellij-platform-2025-3-what-plugin-developers-should-know/

item.title: Why Trust Leads and Speed Follows in Agentic Design
item.description: Every developer recognises the trade-off. You can take the shortcut that delivers today but breaks tomorrow, or choose the slower approach that earns lasting confidence. This dilemma has become even more poignant with the widespread integration of AI agents into real workflows. Speed feels tempting, but speed without trust usually wastes more time than it [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/why-trust-leads-and-speed-follows-in-agentic-design/
